WoS bibliographic data base

Source: R/wos.R
CreateDB.wos.Rd

CreateDB.wos converts a data.frame with WoS variables (see wosdf) into...

CreateDB.wos(wosdf, label = "", print = interactive())

# S3 method for wos.db
print(x, ...)

# S3 method for wos.db
plot(
  x,
  filter,
  which = 1:3,
  plot.summary = FALSE,
  which.summary = 1:5,
  nmax = 10,
  plot.summary.year = FALSE,
  which.summary.year = 1:3,
  accuracy = 0.1,
  ask = (length(which) + plot.summary * length(which.summary) + plot.summary.year *
    length(which.summary.year) > 1) && dev.interactive(),
  ...
)

Arguments

wosdf

data.frame with WoS data... (as returned by ImportSources.wos).
label

character string describing the data.
print

logical; if TRUE the progress is printed.
x

an object used to select a method.
...

further arguments passed to or from other methods.
filter

vector of document identifiers (usually a result of get.idDocs).
which

if a subset of the plots is required, specify a subset of the numbers 1:3.
plot.summary

logical; if TRUE, plot.summary.wos.db is called.
which.summary

indices of the required plots in plot.summary.wos.db.
nmax

number of top levels (see summary.wos.db).
plot.summary.year

logical; if TRUE, plot.summary.year is called.
which.summary.year

indices of the required plots in plot.summary.year.
accuracy

numerical scalar; see label_number(accuracy=.).
ask

logical; if TRUE, the user is asked before each plot, see par(ask=.).

Value

An S3 object of class wos.db. A list with the folowing data.frames:

Docs

Authors AutDoc Categories CatDoc Areas AreaDoc Addresses AddAutDoc Sources

See also

wosdf, ImportSources.wos.

summary.wos.db.

plot.summary.wos.db, plot.summary.year

Examples

db <- CreateDB.wos(wosdf)
str(db, 1)

#> List of 11
#>  $ Docs      :'data.frame':	856 obs. of  25 variables:
#>   ..- attr(*, "variable.labels")= Named chr [1:62] "Publication type" "Author" "Book authors" "Editor" ...
#>   .. ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:62] "PT" "AU" "BA" "BE" ...
#>  $ Authors   :'data.frame':	4053 obs. of  4 variables:
#>  $ AutDoc    :'data.frame':	5511 obs. of  2 variables:
#>  $ Categories:'data.frame':	189 obs. of  2 variables:
#>  $ CatDoc    :'data.frame':	1495 obs. of  2 variables:
#>  $ Areas     :'data.frame':	121 obs. of  2 variables:
#>  $ AreaDoc   :'data.frame':	1364 obs. of  2 variables:
#>  $ Addresses :'data.frame':	3655 obs. of  5 variables:
#>  $ AddAutDoc :'data.frame':	7751 obs. of  3 variables:
#>  $ Sources   :'data.frame':	520 obs. of  14 variables:
#>  $ label     : chr ""
#>  - attr(*, "variable.labels")= Named chr [1:62] "Publication type" "Author" "Book authors" "Editor" ...
#>   ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:62] "PT" "AU" "BA" "BE" ...
#>  - attr(*, "class")= chr "wos.db"
print(db)

#> List of 11
